info.title: Luma API
info.description: API for interacting with Luma's event platform

get.description: Return admin information about an event that you have manage access for.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

get.description:
Every event and API key on Luma is managed by a [Luma Calendar](https://help.lu.ma/p/helpart-hJI2JawEcFaH6he/luma-calendar-overview). You can list all of the events managed by your Calendar by using this API route.

Note that this API route will not list events that are listed on the Calendar but not managed by the Calendar.

parameters.name: api_id
parameters.description: This is the API ID of the guest (not the user).

parameters.name: proxy_key
parameters.description: In the check in QR code, this is the value of the `pk` parameter.

get.description: Get a guest by their Guest API ID, email or Proxy Key.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

get.description: Get list of guests who have registered or been invited to an event.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

get.description: Lookup an entity on Luma by it's slug.
See if an event already exists on the calendar. This is useful when figuring out if you want to submit an event to the calendar.

parameters.name: member_status
parameters.description: This is relevant for Calendar Memberships but not relevant otherwise.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

get.description: List all coupons that have been created for an event..

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request.

parameters.name: pagination_limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. The server will enforce a maximum number.

get.description: List all coupons that have been created for a calendar.

cover_url.description: Specify an image that has been uploaded to the Luma CDN. You can upload an image after getting an upload URL from the Luma API.

description_md.description: Luma stores rich text in a special format called Spark. We don't expose an API for that format, but we can convert Markdown to Spark for you. Some Spark features, like Luma event embeds, are not supported by Markdown.

max_capacity.description:
Once an event hits the max capacity, the event will be marked as sold out and registration will automatically be closed.

If `can_register_for_multiple_tickets` is `true`, each ticket will count towards the max capacity.

name_requirement.description: Luma collects the name of every guest as they register. Choose if you'd like to split this into two fields to encourage guests to enter their first and last name.

reminders_disabled.description: By default, Luma will send reminders before the event. Turn off if you'd like more control over event communications.

show_guest_list.description: When the guest list is shown, approved guests will be able to see who else is going to the event.

slug.description:
The URL slug for the event. If the slug is `aloha`, the URL will be `https://lu.ma/aloha`. If the slug is not available, the event creation will fail.

You can use `/public/v1/entity/lookup` to check if a slug is available.

tint_color.description: A hex color like '#bb2dc7'. This does not support alpha.

cover_url.description: Specify an image that has been uploaded to the Luma CDN. You can upload an image after getting an upload URL from the Luma API.

description_md.description: Luma stores rich text in a special format called Spark. We don't expose an API for that format, but we can convert Markdown to Spark for you. Some Spark features, like Luma event embeds, are not supported by Markdown.

max_capacity.description:
Once an event hits the max capacity, the event will be marked as sold out and registration will automatically be closed.

If `can_register_for_multiple_tickets` is `true`, each ticket will count towards the max capacity.

name_requirement.description: Luma collects the name of every guest as they register. Choose if you'd like to split this into two fields to encourage guests to enter their first and last name.

reminders_disabled.description: By default, Luma will send reminders before the event. Turn off if you'd like more control over event communications.

show_guest_list.description: When the guest list is shown, approved guests will be able to see who else is going to the event.

slug.description:
The URL slug for the event. If the slug is `aloha`, the URL will be `https://lu.ma/aloha`. If the slug is not available, the event creation will fail.

You can use `/public/v1/entity/lookup` to check if a slug is available.

tint_color.description: A hex color like '#bb2dc7'. This does not support alpha.

should_refund.description: If you are declining a guest and they have paid, should we refund their payment?

post.description: Send guest an invite to an event. We will send an email and if there phone number is linked to their Luma account, they will also receive an SMS.

guests.description: Information about the guests you want to add to the event. If a user already has a name, this will not overwrite their name.

message.description: Personalize the message that will be included in the invite. Max of 200 characters.

post.description: Add a guest to the event. They will be added with the status "Going".

items.description: Information about the guests you want to add to the event. If a user already has a name, this will not overwrite their name.

post.description: Name of the host you are adding. If they already have a Luma profile, this will be ignored.

name.description: Name of the host you are adding. If they already have a Luma profile, this will be ignored.

post.description: Create a coupon that can be applied when a guest is registering for an event. You are not able to edit the coupon terms after it has been created.

code.description: This is the code that the user will enter on the event page. It is not case sensitive.  Keep it short.

post.description: Create a coupon that can be applied to any event that is managed by the calendar. Be careful not to have the same code on an event and on the calendar.

code.description: This is the code that the user will enter on the event page. It is not case sensitive.  Keep it short.

post.description: Import people to your calendar to easily invite them to events and send them newsletters.

infos.description: Information about the people you want to import. You can include a name and email. Note that we will not set the name of a user once it has already been set.

tag_api_ids.description: The list of tags to apply to people once you have imported them into your calendar. This can be used to import new members with tags and to tag existing members.

tag_names.description: Note: we will not create tags that do not exist. If you want to use a new tag, create a tag before importing people.

post.description: Add an existing event (on Luma or on an external platform) to the Luma calendar. This will _not_ make the event managed by the calendar.

upload_url.description: You'll upload your image here using a PUT request.

apiKeyAuth.name: x-luma-api-key
apiKeyAuth.description: API key to authenticate requests to the Luma API. Generate an API key on your Luma dashboard.
